item.title: Retrocausality, can the effect come before the cause?
item.description: TL;DR: No. Naturally we, as individuals, are coded to understand that everything happens for a reason. We experience time flowing in the forward direction, it’s how things work. One could argue there’s certain iterations of retrocausality in some type of precognitions if not all, but can it really happen? Retrocausality is a concept of cause and effect in which an effect precedes its cause in time and so a later event affects an earlier one.
